Posted By: storophanthus (11/3/2010 11:41:29 AM)

posts.post_content:
Having just built a deck around this card, I'm very, very surprised it's still legal – I'm of the opinion that it should be banned across the board but restricted in Vintage, simply because it's one of those cards that has so much going for it for so little mana that there's almost no reason for a deck running black *not* to use it. 2 CMC card advantage – compared to the baseline established with [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination) and [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot) – is more powerful than Wizards seems to be comfortable with; adding on to that the enormous number of ways your opponent may be screwed after those two random discards just makes this unbelievable.  
  
Never really having played a dedicated black discard deck before, and not having played at all in years, I'd forgotten how firmly this card can lock down a game. As if a card advantage for 2 wasn't enough, your opponent may very well have discarded their only two lands, or their only two non-lands, or one of their critical co... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Haelthor (10/11/2012 9:43:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
None of my friends understood why this card was good. They insisted that random discard could never be as good as selective discard like [Distress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distress). Then I showed them my discard deck with [Hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn to Tourach) and [Hypnotic Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Specter). Now they understand.  
  
The randomness is the best part. Nobody gets to choose, and so there's no restrictions on what it can hit--anything from a huge bomb to a basic land. Combined with the fact that it hits 2 cards for 2 mana (most new "Discard 2" spells cost 3, see [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot)) and this is easily the best 2cmc discard in the game.
posts.html:
None of my friends understood why this card was good. They insisted that random discard could never be as good as selective discard like Distress. Then I showed them my discard deck with Hymn to Tourach and Hypnotic Specter. Now they understand.

The randomness is the best part. Nobody gets to choose, and so there's no restrictions on what it can hit--anything from a huge bomb to a basic land. Combined with the fact that it hits 2 cards for 2 mana (most new "Discard 2" spells cost 3, see Mind Rot) and this is easily the best 2cmc discard in the game.

posts.post_content:
I used to run a blue-black control deck with four each [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell), [Power Sink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Power Sink), [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim), [Bottomless Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bottomless Pit), this card and a couple [Arcane Laboratory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcane Laboratory) and [Ertai, Wizard Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ertai, Wizard Adept). I had to dismantle that deck due to physical threats.  
  
All the art for this card is pretty awesome in addition to it still being an awesome card after what, 15 years?
